dot.empire.myris

Class Screen

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor
      • com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Group
        • com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.WidgetGroup
          • com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Table
            • com.kotcrab.vis.ui.widget.VisTable
              • dot.empire.myris.Screen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.ai.msg.Telegraph, com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.utils.Cullable, com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.utils.Layout, com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable, SimpleDirectionGestureDetector.DirectionListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ScreenGame, ScreenLoading, ScreenMenuMain, ScreenScore, ScreenSettings, ScreenSplash

    public abstract class Screen
extends com.kotcrab.vis.ui.widget.VisTable
implements com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable, SimpleDirectionGestureDetector.DirectionListener, com.badlogic.gdx.ai.msg.Telegraph
    Represents one of many application screens, such as a main menu, a settings menu, the game screen and so on. Using VisUI default table spacing. Fills screen. Similar framework to com.badlogic.gdx.Screen.
    Author:
    Matthew 'siD' Van der Bijl

      • update

        public void update(float dt)
        Parameters:
        dt - Delta Time is the time it takes for the computer to go through all the processing/rendering for a single frame. It is dynamically updated, so it can fluctuate depending on what level of processing the last frame required
        See Also:
        Graphics.getDeltaTime()

        batch - Used to render textures to the screen
